column2: Complete the sentences. Use the words in brackets.
column3:
Jane is a biology teacher. She likes her job.
She {{c1::likes teaching}} (like / teach) biology.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the words in brackets.
column3:
I used to work in a supermarket. I didn't like it much.
I {{c1::didn't like working}} (not / like / work) there.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the words in brackets.
column3:
Rachel is studying medicine. She likes it.
She {{c1::likes studying}} (like / study) medicine.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the words in brackets.
column3:
Dan is famous, but he doesn't like it.
He {{c1::doesn't like being}} (not / like / be) famous.

column2: Complete the sentences. Use the words in brackets.
column3:
Kate used to live on her own. She hated it.
She {{c1::hated living}} (hate / live) on her own.
